summary: Beyond Uranus’ strange and turbulent atmosphere, this event also provided data on the planet’s ring system and its exact orbit around the Sun. The team was able to make a dry run of the observations in November 2024, when they captured a dimmer Uranus occultation using telescopes in Asia. This is the first time NASA has organized such a large, collaborative observation of a Uranus occultation, the release stated. NASA is already looking ahead to the next big occultation of Uranus in 2031, which will involve an even brighter background star.
